section.name: What is Hippo CMS?
section.span: What part of the Hippo ECM is it, what are its tasks?
all text: move short features list to feature document?
section.p: The Hippo CMS (Content Management System) is the webbased graphical userinterface to the content in the repository of the Hippo ECM. It provides an easy way to create and manage your content, i.e. to write or upload, share, print, search, refer to, edit and structure content, asign rights to do so, have content automatically validated against your business rules and restore previous versions of the content.

tr.td: Content is managed via your normal webbrowser, anywhere you have access to your companies intranet.
Several users may work on the same document, picture, soundtrack or other piece of content. Rights to change pieces of content or just to read them can be assigned.
Advanced methods to search and select content are available to find information to read or the refer to from other documents.
Previous versions of content are stored automatically, so that they can be restored in case users change their mind.

Companies that use Hippo CMS, design their own content structure. Hippo CMS ensures that all content fits into this single structure. Thus, the content base of the company will be filled with information actually useful to the company; required information will actually be there and the content base will be easily understandable and searchable, thanks to its uniformity.
